intro: Synotis managensis, commonly known as the Manangensis Synotis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in shades of yellow and orange. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical climates, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
